column1: Art Institute of Chicago////I entered through the modern wing
column2: and I was given access to the new "The City Lost and Found: New York
column5: 1960-1980" exhibit only. The exhibit included artifacts from historical moments in these three cities
column6: including the Democratic National Convention and development of the South Loop in Chicago. I wasn't very impressed with this exhibit. There was a heavy reliance on black and white photographs
column7: rather than paintings and sculptures. The photographs depicted ordinary life and more times than not
column8: changes in the skyline of these cities. I'm not an art critic
column9: but these were photographs I wouldn't think were "art." Â
